57661.「困ったわ……。\n ラペットおじいさんと 約束したのに。:
I don't know what to do... I promised Mr.
Lapett that I'd help him...

57663.「まあ 旅の方ですね。\n ようこそ 童話の里 メルサンディ村へ。 \n 私は:
Oh, are you a traveler? Welcome to Melsandy
Village, the place of fairy tales. My name
is Aili.

57664.「……そうだわ！ \n お強そうな あなたになら 私の悩みを\n 解決していただ:
I know... yes! You seem really strong.
Do you think you could help me with my
problem?

57665.「私 紙芝居をしている ラペットおじいさんに\n パンを焼いて お届けしますねっ:
I promised to bake bread and deliver it to
Mr. Lapett, who's doing a storytelling show.

57666.「ですが この家で たくわえていた小麦を \n 悪い <%sEV_QUE_NAM:
But those nasty Minidemons stole all of the
wheat we were growing here...

57667.「旅の方 お願いです。 \n <%sEV_QUE_NAME0>さんたちから 小麦:
<if_woman>Ms.<else>Mr.<endif> traveler, do you think you could go
find those Minidemons and get the wheat back?

57668.「まあ！ ありがとうございます。 \n お優しいんですね……。:
Great! Thank you so much! You are so very
kind...

57669.「小麦を盗んだ <%sEV_QUE_NAME0>さんたちは\n メルサンディ穀倉:
The Minidemons who stole the wheat will most
likely be in the Melsandy Millfields. They
should drop it if you defeat them.

57670.「ついでと言ってはなんですが 村の北西の\n メルン水車郷で 小麦をひいてきてい:
I would appreciate it if you could also go
to the Melun Watermill and grind the wheat
there. Please...

57672.「……ごめんなさい。私は\n お部屋の中で お待ちしていますね。:
I'm sorry... I'll be waiting for you in my
room.

57673.「まあ。お優しいんですね。 \n でも 頼まれごとが いっぱいのようですよ。:
Great! You are too kind... but it seems like
you already have a lot of requests.

57674.「どうか ご無理はなさらず\n 手が空きましたら 私のお願いを\n 聞いていただ:
Please, whenever you are free... I'd really
appreciate it if you could do me this
favor...

57676.「……ごめんなさい。\n 私は お部屋に入りますので\n また おヒマな時に 訪:
I'm sorry. I'm going to go into my room, so
please visit me again when you are free.

57677.「そうですね。\n 無理を 言って……: Oh, I see... I suppose I asked too much...

57679.「……ごめんなさい。私は\n お部屋に入りますので もし気が向いたら\n お願い:
...I'm sorry. I'm going back to my room now,
so please see me again if you change your
mind.

57680.「ラペットじいしゃんの\n 紙芝居が はじまるよう！: Lapett's story time is about to begin!

57682.「ほんとよぉ。\n 今日は やらないのかと思っちゃった。:
Me too. I thought you weren't going to do
it today.

57683.「それは～ しゅまんかったの。\n 発声れんすうに 手間どってねえ。:
I see... sorry about that. My voice needed
some more practice...

57684.「ささ 旅人さん。\n もっと 前へどうぞ！: Oh, a traveler. Please, join us!

57685.「うぉっほん。\n それでは わしのいちばんの～親友\n パンパニーニの傑作童話:
A-hem. Now then, for the masterpiece story
of my best friend, Panpanini...

57686.「『小さな英雄ザンクローネの物語』 第３話\n はじまり～ はじまり～～～。:
This is "The Story of the Little Hero
Zankrone", chapter 3.

57687.「さてさて さらわれた姉を助けに\n おどろおどろしゅい 地下水路にやってきた\:
And then, a boy named Raska and a mysterious
traveler delved into a terrifying underground
waterway to rescue his kidnapped sister...

57688.「ズシーーーーーン！！ 大きな音がしゅてね。\n ラスカ少年の 後ろに……:
THUD!! There was a loud noise. Suddenly,
behind Raska there was...

57690.「……ふるえる ラスカ少年！\n チカラいっぱい 叫ぶよ！: Trembling, Raska yelled with all his might!

57692.「すると 不思議な旅人の持つ宝石が\n ピカリと 光った！:
Just then, the mysterious traveler's gem
flashed brightly!

57693.「待たせたな ボウズ！: Sorry to keep you waiting, kid!

57694.「ザンクローネ様は 魔炎の大剣\n 火燐刀を ふり回し……:
And then Zankrone swings his fiery sword
around, the Blazeblade...

57695.「おそろしゅい 手の化け物を \n ザクーッ メコメコーッと やっつけた！\n:
With a pow! And a wham! The scary hand monster
was beaten! His final words were...

57696.「どんな時も 希望は捨てんな。 \n メルサンディ村は 俺とともにある！:
Never give up hope. Leave Melsandy Village to
me!

57697.「こうして 手の化け物は倒され\n 姉のミシュアは 助かったわけだねえ。:
Thus, the hand monster was defeated, and
Mishua was saved.

57698.「しゃて 『小さな英雄ザンクローネの物語』\n 第３話は これでおしゅまい～。:
...and that's all for "The Story of the Little
Hero Zankrone", chapter 3!

57699.「うーん 何度見ても\n ザンクローネの物語は 面白いなあ。:
Bravo! Zankrone's story is enjoyable no
matter how many times I hear it.

57700.「ねーねー ラペットじいさん！\n この続きは？ 続きはないのっ！？:
Hey, hey, Mr. Lapett! Where's the rest of
the story? Is that all?!

57701.「ふーーーむ……。\n しゅまんが 続きはないんだよ。\n さあさ 今日は これ:
I'm sorry to say, but that's as far as the
story goes... anyways, I'll be wrapping up
for today.

57702.「まあ 旅の方 おかえりなさい！\n ラペットおじいさんに パンを届けてくださる:
Oh, welcome back! I could see from here that
you delivered bread to Mr. Lapett.

57703.「無理なお願いを 聞いてくださって\n 本当に ありがとうございます。\n ささ:
Thank you so much for doing me this difficult
favor. Please accept this as my thanks.

57704.「……旅の方。ラペットおじいさんは\n なにか おっしゃってましたか？: Did Mr. Lapett have anything to say?

57705.「まあ。ザンクローネの物語の続きが\n ないのが 残念だと……？:
I see... he thought it was too bad that
Zankrone's story had no ending...?

57707.「童話作家だった パンパニーニおじいさまは\n メルサンディ村を 深く愛し\n:
My grandfather Panpanini was a writer of
children stories. He loved it here so much,
so he wrote a heroic tale set in the village.

57708.「小さな英雄さんの活躍する 童話は\n 村の皆さんに 親しまれ\n 生前に 第３:
The stories about the little hero were loved
dearly by everyone who lived here, and up to
the third chapter was finished.

57709.「そして これが おじいさまが遺した\n 『小さな英雄ザンクローネの物語』の\n:
My grandfather left this book behind, which
contains the fourth chapter of Zankrone's
story.

57710.「けれど……\n あまりに 悲しい結末が描かれているので\n 皆さんには お見せ:
But... the ending is too sad. I don't want to
show it to anyone.

57711.「だから ラペットおじいさんの夢は\n かなえてあげられないんです……。:
So... I can't make Mr. Lapett's dream come
true...

57712.「そうだわ。私ったら うっかり\n あなたのお名前を 聞き忘れておりました。\n:
Oh, I'm sorry. I meant to ask you your name.
Can you tell me?

57713.「……<pc>さんですって？\n おじいさまの 童話に出てくる\n 不思議な旅人:
...<pc>? That's the same name as the
mysterious traveler in my grandfather's
fairy tale.

57714.「……不思議な ご縁ですね。\n また お会いできたら うれしいです。:
A strange coincidence, don't you think?
Well, I hope to see you again soon!

87195.「その小麦を <%nEV_QUE_T_NUM0>つほど集めて\n 束ねたら パン:
I think that if we collect <%dEV_QUE_T_NUM0> bunches of wheat
and bundle it together, that should be plenty
to bake some bread.

87892.「それと お手伝いのルーデさんが\n 気を利かせて 村の宿屋さんのビップルームを:
Oh, and Rudy, our assistant, has graciously
reserved a VIP room at the inn for you to
use if you'd like.
